definition[0]: to divide or share something among several people
example[0]: They didn’t want the federal government parceling out food supplies.
definition[1]: to divide something into several parts, especially in order to share it between several people
example[1]: Farmers argue that parcelling out commercial farmland into small plots will reduce productivity.
example[2]: Savers may withdraw up to $600 from their accounts and any balances will be parceled out in 12 monthly instalments.
